title: Seems invasive
comment: I'm not happy with the forced purchase message that appears when you download more than one extension. Please remove the "this app is entirely open source" message that appears in the app details and make the app a paid app up front to avoid these type of reviews.                                          o·pen-source -   denoting software for which the original source code is made freely available and may be redistributed and modified.  I understand you have to eat but this is trickery.

title: For "Open Source" it's pretty antagonistic
comment: Sure, it does what it says on the tin, but for an open source project, it sure seems against the concept. Don't use two of this guy's extensions together. They will randomly break, encouraging you to make a "one time purchase."  It's sketchy if this can fit the definition of "Open Source" given that F-Droid dropped it, noting that it requires closed-source software to compile. Maybe now it's more compliant.
HSPAP+4G-LTE Speed Test reported
Does not show signal strength or status

title: No good
comment: Tells me that I'm not connected to a network even though I clearly am.

title: Could be a good app
comment: Forcing people to pay for yourapp is the wrong way to get support I could understand if say you couldn't have more then 2 or 3 apps at once with out having to pay but making the app work for a hour then have to pay is just the wrong way to get support for your apps I uninstalled all the extensions I downloaded because they would not work at all and just had a long dashclock list of purchase my app

title: No thanks
comment: I would pay for the key if I weren't being harassed into it. I appreciate your work but there has to be a better way to solicit monetary compensation.

title: Crashing all the extensions
comment: I updated this extension in the morning and suddenly all the extensions started crashing on my Nexus 4

title: More info please!
comment: I'd like dashclock to replace my statusbar. The signal strength should be displayed. Does its job well. missing connection type...

title: Inaccurate
comment: Says I'm on HSPAP when I'm on HCDPA,
Hi, I've deprecated the functionality that displays the network type. I hope you will reconsider your review.

title: Useful
comment: I use pie and have a dashclock on my Homescreen it would be nice if you can show the actual signal strength also with the info.

Hi Ahmed. I'm currently very busy fixing issues with all the extensions but this is in the pipeline. It should be available in the next update. I hope you'll reconsider your review and rating. Thank you.

title: Works great
comment: Shows my network and location just fine. Thanks

title: Vzw HSPAP 4G
comment: Displays Verizon 4g incorrectly.
Hi Daniel, Hi, I've deprecated the functionality that displays the network type because it has often shown incorrect information. I hope you will reconsider your review and rating. Thank you.

title: Wrong info
comment: First of all, I use Verizon so it should say CDMA, but it says HSPAP. Also, when I'm not even connected to a network it says I'm connected to HSPAP 3G. It also says that if I'm on 4G.
Hi, I've deprecated the functionality that displays the network type. I hope you will reconsider your review.

title: Shows wrong type
comment: I'm on EDGE but it shows 3G hspap.
Hi, I've deprecated the functionality that displays the network type. I hope you will reconsider your review.

title: Very useful
comment: Great extension

title: Neat
comment: But Verizon shows as HSPA, when it is a CDMA network. It may be because LTE is evolved from gsm (which is a stretch) but it also says I'm on 3G.
Hi, I've deprecated the functionality that displays the network type. I hope you will reconsider your review.
Nifty

title: Great
comment: This is a nice little extension. Would be great if it could indicate 3G, 4G, edge, etc...
